message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.ST, cs.DS, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with a stochastic linear bandit model, which is a problem in machine learning and optimization. The proposed algorithm, D-LinUCB, is based on discounted linear regression and exponential weights, which are common techniques in the field of machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also deals with non-stationary environments, which is a topic in statistics and time-series analysis. Therefore, cs.ST (Statistics) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also involves studying deviations of sequential weighted least-squares estimator, which is a topic in information theory and signal processing. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is also a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves optimization and algorithm design, which are topics in computer science. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) are also possible sub-categories.
